relevant_findings.description: Document about a Soviet KGB officer named Yurily Ivanovich Nosenko who defected in 1964
relevant_findings.direct_quote: NOSENKO, Yurily Ivanovich, a Soviet KGB officer who defected in 1964 and was subsequently involuntarily confined in the U.S. by the Agency for a period of approximately three years.
relevant_findings.significance: Provides insight into Soviet intelligence defections during the Cold War period surrounding the JFK assassination

relevant_findings.description: Detailed CIA documentation of a KGB defector's movements and confinement
relevant_findings.direct_quote: From April 1964 to August 1965, he was confined at an Agency controlled site in Clinton, Maryland.
relevant_findings.significance: Reveals CIA's internal processes for handling Soviet defectors, including involuntary confinement
